title: AI Workflow & Automation Specialist
job_overview:
About Offshore Launch:

Offshore Launch is on a mission to transform how small businesses scale.

We partner with service-based entrepreneurs to unlock growth through world-class offshore talent. Our remote teaUpgrade to see actual infombers—affectionately called Launchers—aren’t just assistants. They’re operators, problem-solvers, and culture-carriers who power companies behind the scenes.

We’re a people-first, excellence-driven agency that believes in stewardship: leaving every person and business better than we found them.



Why Join Offshore Launch?

Be part of a purpose-driven team serving mission-led entrepreneurs.
Thrive in a remote, high-trust environment focused on ownership and growth.
Receive competitive benefits, including HMO, PTO, paid development, and leadership pathways.
Join a values-based culture grounded in integrity, curiosity, and service.


About the Role

We’re looking for a self-directed builder — someone who sees a messy, manual process and instinctively reaches for a faster, smarter way to solve it. As our AI Workflow & Automation Specialist, you’ll be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining internal and client-facing automations using low-code and no-code tools like Make, Zapier, GPT, Perplexity, OpenPipe, and more.

You’ll be at the frontier of how AI meets service delivery: helping us turn insight into execution, faster than ever before.

This isn’t a role for a traditional software engineer. You don’t need to know how to code — but you do need to know how to think. If you’re resourceful, relentless, and love figuring out how to make tools work together in ways they weren’t originally meant to, you’ll thrive here.



What You’ll Do

Build AI-powered workflows using tools like Make, Zapier, OpenPipe, LangChain, GPT, and mor
Automate recurring internal processes to improve speed, visibility, and accuracy
Develop external-facing automations to help our clients scale faster and serve better
Build internal dashboards or toolkits that give visibility into data, status, or success metrics
Rapidly prototype, test, and refine new ideas — and document what works
Stay ahead of what’s possible in AI tooling and bring those ideas to life inside our systems
Collaborate with our founder and operations team to turn insights into action — fast


What We’re Looking For

Loves building — You’ve created workflows or automations for yourself, your team, or your clients.
Low-code native — You’ve used tools like Zapier, Make, Notion, Airtable, or similar — and you’re quick to learn others.
AI fluent — You’ve played with GPT, Perplexity, Claude, or OpenAI’s APIs. You understand how to use LLMs in workflows.
Fast problem solver — You figure things out with limited instruction. You ask sharp questions. You ship.
Structured thinker — You can visualize systems, break down logic, and explain your thinking clearly.
Detail-oriented — You test your workflows. You spot edge cases. You clean up what you build.
Bonus: Experience building tools or automations for operations, staffing, or client service teams.
Excellent written and spoken English — You must be able to document processes clearly, communicate ideas with precision, and participate in fast-paced discussions.


Compensation & Benefits:
- Competitive monthly compensation
- Starts at $1,000–$1,500 USD/month, with potential to grow to $1,800–$2,000+ for top performers who demonstrate speed, ownership, and strong execution
- Annual bonus equivalent to one month salary 
- Performance-based bonuses
- Comprehensive HMO policy, including dependents (depending on location and local policy availability)
- Annual continuing education budget to support professional development
